alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden; Gloucester (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 3:27PM EDT until May 27 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 400 PM EDT FOR CAMDEN...SOUTHEASTERN GLOUCESTER AND CENTRAL BURLINGTON COUNTIES... At 327 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Chesilhurst, or 14 miles southeast of Gloucester City, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Evesham, Mount Laurel, Voorhees, Medford, Lindenwold, Hammonton, Berlin, Tabernacle, Shamong, Chesilhurst, Ramblewood, Sicklerville, Atsion, Echelon, Marlton, Springdale, Atco, Victory Lakes, Williamstown and Greentree. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 4. Interstate 295 in New Jersey near mile marker 38. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 31 and 44. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
